titleStmt.title: Where in a proclamation (lately by us published) for considerations therein expressed, we prescribed a course whereby the complaints of our people might be taken away, ...
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1603-1625 : James I)
James I, King of England, 1566-1625.

publicationStmt.publisher: by Robert Barker, printer to the Kings Most excellent Maiestie.,

notesStmt.note: At end of text: Greenwich the 16. day of June, in the first yeere of our reigne of England, France, and Ireland, and in the sixe and thirtieth of Scotland.
Announcing that the patent for tin has been surrendered. Cf. STC.
In this edition line 3 of text ends: iust-.
Title from opening lines of text.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
